Appalachian Queer Youth Summit in Summer 2020
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
Take Action Now

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Being a kid can be tough. Being a kid in rural Appalachia can be even tougher, but being a queer kid in rural Appalachia? That's its own kind of tough. Even in our digitally connected age, it's easy for LGBTQ-identifying youth in West Virginia to feel isolated, out of place in their communities, and even full of despair.

This summer, ACLU-WV, in partnership with Amizade, is going to break down those barriers of isolation with the first-ever Appalachian Queer Youth Summit.

We'll bring together high school juniors and seniors (homeschool students welcome) who either identify as LGBTQ or come from LGBTQ families from across West Virginia in a summer-camp style setting and give them the tools they need to organize around the issues most important to them.

Campers will learn about how to talk to legislators, run meetings, create powerful storytelling, and more. They will be given funds to create a collective action after the camp is over. They'll also get to meet community leaders who are like them and attend a college fair.

Perhaps most importantly, they'll get to be themselves for a weekend around people who understand them. Find more information on our website and follow our AQYS Facebook page for updates.

Camper applications are open now! The application deadline is March 5.

Are you interested in volunteering? Apply today! Volunteer applications must be submitted by March 15.

We can't wait to see y'all at the Summit!

Thanks for sticking with us,

ACLU of West Virginia
